definition: to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

sentences.english: She's very good at dealing with all kinds of people; she never puts a foot wrong.
sentences.chinese: 她善於與各種各樣的人打交道，從來不出紕漏。

sentences.english: "Full page" fake tickets, while high degree of simulation, but there are a lot of flaws.
sentences.chinese: “整版”假票仿真度雖高，但也有不少紕漏。

sentences.english: Once concreted, it is easy to find the careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 而任何事一旦具體了就很容易找出它的紕漏之處。

sentences.english: Many people and institutions made leveraged bets that have since gone sour.
sentences.chinese: 許多個人和機構的槓桿押注後來都出了紕漏。

definition: lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
(idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
readily following good advice (idiom); willing to accept other people's views
to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
